system.description:
Oracles and diviners who watch the sky, the movement of the stars, the position of the Great Sky Serpents, and the lay of the waters to predict fortunes in the past and the future

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Dragon Dancing The Night Sky. Attack all enemies in path 5 with Bravery, then all allies in the path gain +1d on their next attack.

Gambits [[/r d12]]

1-3: Inflict Violence > Inflict Violence > Inflict Violence

4-6: Rush > Inflict Violence > Rahu [1]: Give an ally in range 4 Block 1.

7-9: Rush > Inflict Violence > Kedu [1]: Give an ally in range 4 Skewering and Overwhelming on their next attack.

10-12: Svarbhanu Nature [3]: The jyotisha starts chanting. They become unable to move voluntarily until the end of their next riff, but all allies in the battlefield cannot fall to 0 HP while the jyotisha is chanting.

traits.name: Conviction
traits.description: All Folk have a reason for fighting, and if reasoned to, can cause them to rethink combat. However, they will fight for their Conviction until it looks like all is bleak.

traits.name: Morale
traits.description: At the beginning of any Resound where there are twice as many Kadungganan than there are enemies (eg., If there are 4 Kadungganan and 2 Enemies left) all Folk enemies will Surrender, becoming Defeated.

traits.name: Turn The Wheel
traits.description: At the beginning of every Resound, all Ba-enense fighters gain 1 Merit, which they can gain up to 3 of. All Ba-enense add their current Merit as attack dice.

traits.name: Karmic Fate
traits.description: When an enemy in burst 3 performs a hostile action, all allies in the burst may fly 1 before the action, 1/Resound. The attacker then suffers -1d on their next Defense roll
